text: 330ml bottle. Pours clear amber colour, small beige head, stays as ring. Sweet malty, raisiny, bready, sweet aroma. Taste is malty sweet, creamy. Silky creamy texture, medium bodied, below average carbo. Watery aftertaste. Interesting and drinkable, easy brew.

330ml bottle. Hazy dark golden color. Medium size, thick white head, stays. Metallic, grainy, citrus, dusty in aroma. Dusty, grainy, metallic, chalky in taste. Dusty and grainy and metallic hops in aftertaste. Fizzy carbonation. Simple, but watery. Drinkable brew.

Bottle (from Koht). Pours amber with huge beige head. Aroma is grainy, malty, cardboard, some sour almost acetone like notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, some sourness, grainines, maltiness. Finish has some dryness. Carbonation is crisp. Overall: feels slightly off, but otherwise ok brew.
Bottle. A really good, interesting and unusually hoppy hellerbock. Heavy woody and marzipan-like maltiness. Also notes of herbs and grapefruit.

Prodotta per infusione di malti dorzo tipo Pilsener, Munchen e speciali, viene fermentata con un lievito di bassa alquanto particolare e capriccioso, che regala però eleganti e inusuali note di frutta fresca. Luppoli tedeschi da amaro e dosi massicce di Styrian Golding donano un tocco nobile allaroma; completato da un leggero dry hopping con miscela anglo-tedesca.
Maltas, herbáceos, ligero cítrico y sulfuro con un cuerpo maltosa y pleno y un final de amargor medio largo y seco.
From 32GP. In Teku glass. After dinner. Malty, with some caramel and nuts. Noble grassy hops very well placed compensating. What stands out is its velvety smooth oily texture.

330ml bottle. Pours amber colour. Thin white head. Slightly malty, bit caramelly, slightly raisiny aroma. Caramel, slight bitterness at first. Slight notes of malts and bitterness. Raisiny notes. Caramelly, slightly bitter finish. Rather light bodied, moderately carbonated, solid brew.

33cl Can @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Amber colour with small white head.
Aroma is malt, caramel, honey.
Taste is malt, caramel, nuts, apricot.
Medium body, soft to medium carbonation.
On tap at The Bottle Shop Bermondsey. Clear russet amber colour lasting beige head. some earthy bock flavour. Some hop bitterness on the finish. Served a little cold ok bock.

on tap at saint-bock, mtl. hazy dark golden orange pour with a small light beige head offering some retention and lacing. spicy red apples, sweet ones, jelly in fact, lots of berries as well, complex red caramel, whatever that is, woodsy cognac alcohol, spices. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and spicy finish. not a heller bock, but a plain sweet red bock.

From the tap, at La Fatica, Rimini, Italy. Pours amber, with moderate white head. Aroma is malty and floral. Body is medium. Taste is moderately sweet. Very low bitterness. Finish is relatively dry.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Draught at Il Locale, Copenhagen. Clear golden/orange beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, fruity, some grass. Malty fruity flavor, grassy, citrus, some caramel. Ok.
From tap at Il Locale. Clear amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, hops, fruit, bread and bitterness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Locale, Copenhagen - Amber pour with white head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, with some herbal grassy hoppy notes, some caramel notes, hoppy bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Style et résumé: Bock qui manque de caractère. 
Comment: En fût au Saint-Bock. 
Description: Un liquide jaune orangée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez de caramel, de toffee, de sucre beige et de pomme verte. Cest vrai. Une bouche de caramel, fruitée avec une pomme légère. Manque de caractère.
Note:  6/10

Pours hazy dark golden with a medium white head. Aroma has raisions, some dark fruits, quite malty and yeasty. Taste is a bit fruity with some malts and a soft to medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.

Nice deep amber bock from Birrificio Italiano. A little floral and herbal hop in the aroma and a little more cuts through on the palate, enough to notice but not so much as to distract from the toasty and slightly sweet malt flavors. 
Often a little hazy.
Great bock from one of the best Italian breweries.

Keg at the brewery restaurant. A clear amber orange coloured pour with a frothy off white head. Aroma is soft sweet brown bread, light toffee, light fried fruits. Flavour is composed of nice rounded bready malts, brown bread, some spicy dried fruits, low toffee. Palate is gentle soft carbonation, semi sweet, frothy. Decent.

Birra in stile bock. Quando si scalda il malto si sente meglio, da fredda si sente molto meno. Carbonazione, colorazione e schiuma nello stile e molto buona. Non vado pazzo per le bock ma questa è ben fatta. Lamaro è ben equilibrato e poco accentuato, il giusto ber bilanciare il dolce dei malti.

Caramel, toffee, bread and sweet grain malts. Slightly hazy, dark gold, massive, creamy, off-white head. Medium sweet. Lactose, caramel, sweet pale malts, molasses, lively carbonation. Nice Bock, not too sweet, yet lacks some complexity. Keg at Il Santo Bevitore, Venice.

Keg @ Il Locale, Copenhagen. Looks great!! Slightly hazy, deep amber, dense long lasting off-white head, rich lacing. Sweet malty aroma, toast, honey, grains and orange marmalade. Soft mid-sweet mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Sweet fruity taste, peach, sticky fresh apricot, honey, caramel and earthy hops. Warming and grassy mild bitter finish with a hint of alcohol shining through.
On tap. Amber colour. Malt and caramel aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, nuts and dark fruits taste. Medium body.
Tap at Abirradero. Clear dark golden to amber with off white head. Caramel, light sugary, raisins, dried apricot. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with slick feel.
De tirador al Abirradero. Cervesa amb aromes de malts torradets que recorden al pa torrat, crosta de pa, galeta i també mel. També te un punt floral. Carbonatació baixa, final equilibrat i mig-sec.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso rimanda a frumento e lievito. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello è di schiuma compatta, cremosa, aderente ed ha una buona tenuta. Le bollicine sono medie con carbonazione media-abbondante. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Anche al piano inferiore le bollicine sono medie. La carbonazione è abbondante, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è ambrato carico tendente rossiccio. Il corpo è strutturato. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è molto elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole e godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono lunghe e dalla pericolosa beverinità. Il finale è lungo, pulito e complesso. Il tetto della bocca riporta sentori di miele, cereali, frutta secca, resina, fiori, erba, agrumi, erbe aromatiche, lievito, terra, foglie e zenzero.
Bärnstensfärgad öl med inslag av rött med ett lättare skum. Söt maltighet i doften tillsammans med mörkt socker. I smaken tillkommer viss örtighet och gräsighet. Något för söt för min smak.
Light brown colour with lasting head. Aroma and flavour have light toasty malts and hints of caramel. Fairly bland though and lacking in carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours clear light amber with small white head. Aroma is light malty with a fruity caramel touch. Tadte is sweet malty, with caramel and a hint of dried fruit and ends in slight bitterness.

Draught at Himmeriget.
Clear orange colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Sweet and malty aroma of caramel and bread.
Sweet and malty flavor of caramel and bread.
Malty finish.
A high quality beer. Caramel sweetness, flavours of toasted barley, hops and citrus. Pours golden -top draw!
A nice malty texture with a sharp alcohol taste coming through. Its rather decent actually. Happily have a few of these!
Clean amber, orange drop colour. Medium straight head, medium retention. Aroma intensity 4/5. Cut grass aroma, sweet notes of peach. Three layers of bitter. Medium body
Cask at Linen Weaver JDW. Light amber with excellent lacing. Malty, boozy aroma with some spice. You notice it is a bock, with a fairly short aftertaste.

Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, bread and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel, bread and dried fruity finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
UPDATED: MAR 16, 2016 Okay. Good strength caramel and malty aromas and taste and flavour. Nice on palate
Kick 061115. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel, grass, hop, malt. Flavour is caramel, hop, malt, dried fruits, apricot, pine, grass. OK beer.

Supert krankupp på Circus 25.1.16 sammen med Ovesen. Klar kobbergylden med superb skum. Elegant og fruktig (aprikos/fersken) maltdrevet øl med stor drikkbarhet. Humlene er bl.a Styrian Goldings som gir en flott bukett av florale, lett krydrede toner. Kjenner jeg også litt honning? Cremet mundfylde.

From tap at Cirkus with JMD 25.01.16. Dark goldeb. Persistent beige head and lacing. Fruity aroma with some malt and hop. Full, and fruity, flavour, with fresh plums, honey and refreshing hop bitterness. Very quaffable!

From bottle to glass at FCO. Its not really a bock but it is not unpleasant either. Decent head with lots of lacing. Aroma is unremarkable. The taste has a slight astringency. It tastes of malt and a little honey. Mouthfeel is ok. The color is an interesting copper that almost matches the label on the bottle. Its a good beer. Overall pleasant. 

And the bottle is amazingly thick.

On tap at Kick. A clear, dark golden beer with a small, dense, off-white head. Sulphur, caramel malts, some dried apricots and pine cones and grass. Sulphur, hay, grass and caramel malts in the flavor. Decent bitterness. Full body and a soft carbonation. Long finish. Weird aroma in this one, but its actually quite tasteful and it drinks easy. 151106

Ambrata, arancia, schiuma bianco sporco persistente e croccante. Aroma di miele di castagno, qualche agrume ed un po di biscott al burro, mandorle inn sottofondo. In bocca cè miele al castagno, fiori darancio, un po di pane al burro ed una tostatura che ricorda le mandorle tostate. Finale secco, leggermente amaro, che asciuga la dolcezza iniziale e predispone bene per il sorso successivo. Carbonatazione media e corpo snello, con la bevuta che risulta molto facile.

Robe ambrée, brillante, légèrement trouble. Belle mousse dense, beige, moyennement persistante. Au nez des arômes de céréales, pain grillé, mélasse mêlés aux arômes métalliques et dalcool. Pétillante, crémeuse, son corps est riche et généreux. Belle amertume qui se transforme subtilement en douceur, rappelant un biscuit petit-beurre par exemple. Pas dune grande richesse aromatique. Un style parfaitement réussi même si par définition je ne suis pas fan de ce style de bières. Jen rependrai !

500ml Draught from Il Santo Bevitore, Venice, Italy (7.00):
One that I wasnt all that sure about when I was drinking it, it was easy enough to drink & didnt really have any off-flavours but it was also one-dimensional & unexciting with the nose lighter than Id have liked. The beer is quite an average offering & not one that Id recommend.
Aroma and taste grave nothing to do with bock style. Its more similar to an IPA, but the bitterness its not balanced.

Spina. Colore ambrato, buon cappello di schiuma bianco opaco, media persistenza. Aroma di malto, caramello e in evidenza anche i luppoli, che donano un sentore erbaceo. Gusto in primis dolce, moderatamente, per lasciare il finale amaro dei luppoli, malto in evidenza. Corpo medio, carbonatazione media. Una buona birra, che mi sento sempre di consigliare.

On tap at Il Santo Bevitore in Venice, pours a murky orange with some creamy, slightly off white head. Nose of yeast and straw, some light butterscotch, honey. Flavor is the same, malty sweet, yeast, dough. Crisp finish.
Il Profumo dei suoi luppoli è persistente, al palato esprime tutta la sua robustezza, lascia un buon sentore di cereali, piena.
Ottima birra , bella schiuma , naso pulito. In bocca vellutata con un buon malto. ottima

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Yoav. Hazy orange with a big head and many bubbles. Smell and taste of honey, biscuits,earthy hops, bread, yeast and alcohol. Sweet malty flavors with mild bitterness. Medium-bodied, sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks Yoav. A little hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus and some honeysuckle as well as some minerals. Mildly bitter taste, with diluted honey sweetness. Medium body, mildly carbonated and mild floral aftertaste. Feels a little old.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks Yoav. Hazy golden-orange with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, honey, bread, fruitiness, oxidation, a bit of alcohol and a bit of hoppy hints. Sweet flavor with malt, honey, a bit of oxidation, fruitiness, caramel, a bit of alcohol, light hoppiness and some bitterness. Medium-bodied, slightly sticky.

Prodotta dal noto Birrificio Italiano, birra color ambra da 6%, gran cappello di schiuma densa e persistente, nonostante una prevalenza dolce di malto ha una discreta tendenza allamaro dato dal luppolo ben presente, cosa poco frequente nelle bock. Buono lodore appena speziato. Da provare senza alcun dubbio.
Bottle 33 cl. Amber, clear with a medium creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, bread and caramel sence. Light bitter sweet with a sweet malt ending.

Draft @ Hoppy Days. Pours a hazy orange beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is very faint, malty and caramel, not much else and quite boring. Flavor is medium sweet and malty again. Quite fruity in the aftertaste, but besides that theres not much special going on here.

Amber color, very nice white head.
Mostly hops in the aroma, they give a nice herbs smell. Some dark honey aroma is also present.
Taste: sweet at first, minor sourness, then good hop bitterness in the end.
Medium body, warm feeling in the mouth.
Poured a dark orange amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of caramel malt, sweet berries. Medium body, flavour as the aroma.

On tap at Hoppy Days. Clear light-amber colour, white head. Aroma of sweet malts, some honey, toast, light caramel, some grassy hops. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, toast, caramel, grassy hoppy bitter finish. Light to medium-bodied. OK stuff.

On tap at Hoppy Days. Clear deep gold pour with tenacious white head. Aroma is malty, fruity, light biscuity notes. Taste is sweet, malty, light honey and alcohol. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Decent.

Draught @ Hoppy Days. Clear orange to amber color, full sized white head. Aroma is malts, hayish. Taste malts, hayish, slightly grainy, light to moderately bitter with a hint of sweet grains. Average body and carbonation. Decent.

Appearance is amber and clear, some white froth but not much head. Aroma is caramel, malty, hint of dark fruit. Taste- malty, caramel and toffee, plenty of carbonation, hint of raisin, sweet finish. Pretty good.
Draft at Hoppy Days. Pours Amber with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, malt, light fruit. Flavour is over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

0,2L draught [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bierdorf, Tettnanger Hopfenwandertag 2014. Pours honey amber, none too viscous, nor fuming in aroma: caramel, wild honey. Easily drinkable, well balanced, with some unusual exotic fruit notes and again that elegant, pillowy BI yeast profile. Hence much more of a pleasure to down than many a residual sugar-drowned DE heller Bock.

Draught @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. September 2013. Hazy amber beer with a big head. Aroma has caramel malts with hops. Sweetish and fruity flavour is caramel and grainy malts. Quite nice, decently hoppy bock.

Spina @ luppoleria.
Ambrata con schiuma fine persistente.
Delicata e con una bella maltatura, ottima bassa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Beige creamy head. Copper colour. Aroma is moderately malty with nutty, hoppy and light peach notes. Flavor ia moderately malty with fruity (peach) and hoppy and spicy tones, ending in a bitter slightly spicy finish. Medium bodied.
Bibock 6,2% more pale ale than a bock. Nice bitterness. lekker. Bitter and full bodied. On tap at ma che siete venuti a fa roma
Bottle from Vesuvio, Darlington. An amber ale with a white head. Sweet with caramel notes. Plenty of hop too. Pineapple in there. nive and flavoursome.
Bottle in Italy. Clear copper pour. Aroma of fruity malts, apricot, raisins, nuts, some sugars and slightly spicy. Flavor is quite bitter and nicely sweet in a very decent balance. Thick body.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015  Nose is a blend of malt and strong HERBAL hops!!!Taste is sweet and strongly herbaceous!An unusual italian beer!
Slight haze, light amber, aroma is a bit spicy, with a dash of malts that are biscuity and caramelly. Decent if not hugely bockish.

Tap at BKL 2014. 
Fresh grassy, slightly earthy nose
Hazy dark amber, low offwhite head 
Fresh wellbalanced crisp medium light malt body with a fresh hop counterpoint. Really nice and moreish.

Unfortunately my feeling for the aroma is about pasta with mushrums, not quite a beer aroma...
But the taste is quite good. Some sweet and some bitter from hops
Pours a deep orange with a big,thick and foamy head. Aroma is sweet yeast, malts. Taste is quite malty,slight hoppy bitterness in the finish.
Una bock non male in effetti, originale e fuori dal comune. Con una luppolatura leggera e floreale che arricchisce la maltatura di base. Si fa bere!

Draught in Ma Che Siete Venuti (Rome) during December 2013.

Clear golden amber body with a white crown on top.

The nose was a blend of malted grains and floral/herbal hops, as was the taste. The malts lead in the flavour stakes with the hop content giving a dry and slightly bittering finish. I also picked up a mild citrus hint in the taste.

Pleasant and well made Bock, pleased I tried it.

Tap @Ma Che Siete Venuti
Clear deep golden-amber color, good creamy white head. Hayish hoppyness in the nose, some maltyness. Medium-bodied, even a bit weak for this ABV. Fruity, malty with clean mouthfeel. Light hayish-grassy hoppyness.
On tap. Amber with small white head. Aroma malty, some caramel, some iron. Taste is more malty, good body, middle bitter finish.
Tap. Light brown. Soft carbonation. Taste is fruity and quite hoppy. Refreshingly bitter aftertaste.

(Flasche) Es hat eine orangene Farbe, ist opaleszierend, mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist fruchtig, mandarinig mit einer leichten Süße. Der Geschmack ist fruchtig, etwas bitter, eher schlank und leicht süß. Die Karbonisierung passt

(bottle) pours a hazy deep amber colour with a frothy white head. aroma of orange peel, yeast, straw, light herbal hops, nettles and gooseberries. flavour is mostly the same, heavy herbal hops, with a sharp gooseberry fruitiness, more yeast and a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bella e versatile, gradevolmente maltata e con una luppolatura lieve, ben equilibrata!

500ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Santo Brevitore. Pours an orange hazy body, with a light pink foamy head and beautiful lacing. Fresh fruits and grapefruit to the nose, very inviting. Tastes of refreshing citrus, hops and some sweet malty notes, spices and herbs. Its crisp like carrot! Really great after a day filled with sightseeing, shopping and new adventures on Murano, Burano and in Venice. (18.05.13)

Bottle @ Christers. Pours slightly hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of malt, light sweet caramel, bread, little fruit, hay. Flavor is malt, bread, caramel, honey, little fruity hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 130513

Bottle from Euston Tap, London. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 1305013

Bottle, 6.2%. Slightly hazy amber/brown with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit, hop and a little bread. Flavour is malt, caramel, medium sweet, bread, little toasted and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are pleasant hops, balanced caramel, grass, straw and malt. Nice and easy drinkable with nice bitter finish.

on tap @ Linganno.  Interessante birra che si ispira alle bock tedesche. Il profumo è decisamente luppolato, tra lerbaceo ed il floreale con qulche sentore di tostato. la schiuma è biancastra e poco persistente con bolle disomogenee. Il colore è ambra/rame a metà tra il torbido ed il chiaro.  Il guso è tipico delle bock, quasi ferroso, con sentori tostati e con qualche accenno di caramello. Poi interviene la luppolatura decisa che la rende amara nel finale. é di gusto pieno, corpo rotondo e presenta un finale lungo e amaricato

1st September 2012Hazy amber beer, tidy off white head. Smooth palate with fine carbonation. Mild smooth malt, very light caramel. Mild minerals. Nice fresh orange and a modicum of marmalade. Pinch of spice. Semi dry finish. Not bad at all.

330ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Cloudy copper body with a solid lasting beige head. Aroma of apricot, light roast malt and perfumy hops. Flavour was very dry, lightly toasted yeasty malt, dry hops and a nice kick of tart fruit at the end. Not bad.

75 cl bottle @ HBF.
Originally rated on 20100409.
Pours copper color with a small head. Aroma of malts, caramel, sweet fruits and yeast. Flavor of caramel malts, some yeast and toffee.
Birra di buona consistenza, al naso poco aromatica e odore deciso di malto. Buona schiuma

Amber coloured and hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Sweet aroma, bread, sugars, faint fruit and yeast. Sweet harmonic flavor, nice,  more bread, faint soft fruit, faint cocolate, light. Creamy, syrupy texture and soft carbonation.
nice sweet caramel and bread,golden, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish.
Bevuta al "ma che...". Ottima sia al naso che al palato. Estremamente equilibrata con una picevole punta luppolata in un mare di tonalitá maltate.

10/12/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Ambrata intensa, con riflessi fulvi, schiuma abbondante bianca, molto persistente. Al naso malto, note tostate e caramello, con una bella presenza di luppolo. In bocca è magnifica, malto ovviamente grande protagonista, note di miele, biscotto, leggero affumicato, finale luppolato secco e pulito. Corpo medio, carbonazione corretta. Ottima.

330ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy dark caramel with a small head.  Aroma is pithy orange and grapefruit with toast and raisin.  Taste is grainy with orange pith to start.  Alcohol warmth and caramel in the finish.

Pour is a hazy ruby caramel with a creay, tight, bubbly light tan head.  Nose is a little grainy with a hint of cereal.  Lots of hops behind with citrus and pine, rather resinous.  Taste is toasted malts with a bit of caramel and brown sugar.  Light citrus in back with a very oily hop presence.  Body is light, clean, and crisp with a very soft carbonation.
Amber color , clear. Good aroma fruit and citrus, malt and caramel. Taste is balanced with medium body.

Bottle at Gran Caffe Roma. Great, complex taste. Aromas of caramel and dough, with hints of chocolate. Taste is sweet, with bitter and sour notes; long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Amber, with a frothy head.

Cask at Ma Che, Trastevere, Roma - 02/10/12.
Lightly hazed amber with a Mr Whippy off white head.
Nose is malt forward with a little spice.
Tastes of biscuit malts, toffee, a little ginger, background hops and fruit loaf bread.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a sweetish finish. Decent stuff!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 33 cL bottle bought from Great British Beer Festival 2012, poured into a Westmalle glass at home.  A generous bubbly head over a vibrant orange/red beer.  Lovely citrus aroma.  Light, candy sweetness, very smooth.  Fruity, but a little too dry in the finish.  Nice.
Herb-malziger, etwas hopfiger Beginn. Würzig, etwas süßlich, karamellig. Rund, ausgewogen, aromatisch. Balanciert, geringe Fruchtigkeit. 11/13/13/12//12

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Amber red body and small head. Mild spices, yeasty backup, some German hops. Medium sweet, maybe too much.But quite well rounded. Good quality and enough interesting t try. (On tap at Italian beer bar in Valencia)

Re-rate: Golden amber body and head. Hoppy, fresh, mild spice, grassy, lighter than expected. Malty body in taste profile, full enough, well balanced. Good quality, nice brew. (On tap at Hoppy Days with Oudejaarsticken)
Per essere una Bock risulta decisamente luppolata ma a parer mio la rende ancora più fresca e bevibile con un bel accostamento tra fruttato ed erbaceo...notevole!
Amber body with a tall lasting whit ehead. Floreal aroma with some caramel. Taste is pretty the same. Too hoppy for being a bock, a good beer anyway.

Ottima!! Aroma fruttato con un sottofondo piacevolmente luppolato. Al gusto eccoci di nuovo a parlare di frutta con una predominanza di albicocca matura. Torna in sordina, e non te laspetti, il luppolo (Diamine è una Bock!!!) che pulisce la bocca e la rigenera. Gustosa. Questi la birra la sanno veramente fare.

Draught, half pint at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Next to clear golden-brown body, topped by a beige head. Floral fruity aroma with earthy malts behind. Toffee-like malt in flavour joined by grassy hops. Malt-bitter ending. Crispy in the mouth. Well-balanced and refreshing (Roma, 30.03.2012).

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Lovely bright amber color with a tall head. Nice aroma of noble (Saaz?) hops, earthy amber malts, caramel. Flavor is caramel and a bit of somewhat strange fruitpeaches or berries maybe? Caramel is light but there. Nice, grassy hops. Very drinkable and tasty, and well hopped for a bock. One of the best in the style Ive had.
Come Heller Bock è un po particolare per via dellutilizzo massiccio di luppoli in quantità maggiore che nella tradizione tedesca, non mi ha soddisfatto molto.

On tap at Selezione Birra 2012, Rimini. Pours a light brown color with a small tan head. Aroma is grassy and hoppy with floral notes. Taste has a good amount of hops on a sweet-ish caramel malty base. Good carbonation. Nice balance and quite tasty.

Pours light brown with a decent white head. Nose is hoppy, pilsner smell. Both in malt and in hops. Taste is mostly bitter with some minimal sweetness. Mothfeel is crisp and sharp. Nice aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bella bock pulita, dolce e avvolgente, rotonda, non sfigura di fronte alla più blasonata tipopils.
Draft at Ma Che Siete in Rome. Rich amber, foamy head. Pretty tart, right bock. Smooth, dry-funk finish. Great balance, interesting.
Bottled. The aroma has grass and bready caramel malts. Copper - reddish coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is light sweet and bitter, has some grass, caramel malts and grains. Good bock.

Hazy chestnut with a white ring. Nose is too sweet, some balance from banana and burnt toffee, light citrus. Flavor has some bubblegum, toast, and more toffee, light cardboard mid-palate when the flavor just dies. Drying body, absent finish.
Una delle perle fisse al ma che siete venuti a fà! Non il mio stile, la trovo troppo dolce, ma è indubbiamente ben fatta e sempre gradevole.

Bottle at Domus Birrae.
Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma moderate+ malty (caramel). Flavor moderate+ sweet, some bitterness in the finish. Quite full-bodied.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2nd ES/CS Beer Tasting. (thanks MM!). Reddish amber colour with small off-white foamy head. Aroma is bready and sweet caramel malts along with toffee and fudge. Flavour is quite much the same, but also has some mild floral and grassy bitter notes in the finish. A bit watery, but otherwise decent bock.
Colore ambrato con leggero cappello di schiuma. Aroma tra il malto, il fruttato e il floreale del luppolo. In bocca molto pulita, equilibrata, secca e con un buon retrogusto amarognolo.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Rome. The pour is a clear orange amber topped by a ten foot tall eruption of a head that takes about 10-15 minutes to settle down. Insane. Aroma is fresh orange, malt, ample, oatmeal, cherries. Taste is malty, toast, orange candy, bitter, fresh grainy. Palate is suddy, bitter, not sweet or syrupy. Drank a pint of this in about 4 minutes.

Bevuta alla spina al Ma che siete venuti a fà. Ambrata, intensa, con buona schiuma. Aroma di malto, caramello, frutta. In bocca non troppo complessa, dolciastra con finale luppolato. Ben fatta, senza dubbio, ma niente di trascendentale.
Alla spina a Rimini, Selezione Birra, una buona bock rossiccia che ho assaggiato dal bicchere di Elena

Bottle I think at Eataly, Bologna, 26.02.11   Pours mid-amber with a white bubbly head. This was touch hazy but otherwise looking fine. Notes are getting lazier, heavy day drinking but suffice to say this was fine.  A6 A4 T6 P3 Ov12 3.1

26/02/2011 - Alla spina al Blind Pig.
Con un bel colore ambra, un bel cappello di schiuma, bella limpida si fa bere con piacere.
Lascia un leggero amarognolo che risulta comunque non eccessivo e gradevole.
Ricorda molto alcune tedesche in effetti; se capita la riberrei volentieri.
Bottled. Poured deep amber in colour with off-white head. Aroma is malty with some spices. Flavour dry, honey and malty.

Tap. Rusted orange hue with a light tan head. Lightly sweet malt aroma, that is mostly sweet with some fruits.  Malty and sweet are the words for the taste, and just dont do much.  Medium body with soft carbonation.  OK, but just not all that good.

First time on tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà then on bottle, its a pleasant Italian bock style beer. Its not my favourite one, but I appreciate its full-bodied characteristic, the dark color and the not high carbonation. Its bitter enough, even if it is not as well as it sister Tipopils. Even if it is certainly a good product, I prefer the original German bocks.

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa, Rome. Red amber with white head. Quite a deep and fruity beer with a slightly sucrose sweetness, caramel with light maltiness. There is a hint of hop with a sharpness, crystal malt note. reasonable.

beautiful ruby color with orange highlights. full-bodied and intense. Soft, caramel, hints of fruit, spice, resin, a pinch of dry hops. structured, it seems more content than it is. good example of Italian craftsmanship.                             bel colore rubino con riflessi aranciati. gusto pieno e intenso. morbida, caramellata, sentori di frutta, sepziata, resina, un pizzico secco di luppolo. strutturata, sembra più alcolica di quello che è. buon esempio di artigianale italiana.

On draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa in Rome. pours a dense amber with slight white head. Odd aroma bordering on estery. Medium body with solid mouthfeel. Malty sweet flavor with subtle hop bitterness present. Late caramel notes and sticky finish. Disappointing distracting flavor for a "low fermentation" beer.

Draught, Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome.

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is cloudy medium brown.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (caramel, nuts), with light notes of gum, toffee, and plum.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

A bit odd in the nose for a bock, but not unpleasant.  Quite sweet, but not out of character.  Just ok.

On tap. RBESG Rome 2010. Clear amber golden with a dense off-white head. Sweet caramel nose. Quite full-bodied with a classic and clean profile of roasted malt and caramel. Some hops in the finish. A very classic, clean and good Bock - but Id say this is a Dunkler rather than Heller Bock. 040610
Amber with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with caramel, and a little herbal hop character. Dry and herbal flavour with a decent malty background

Bottle: Poured a reddish orange with an off white head. Aroma is mixed malts mostly caramel, but some roasted. The taste was similar with lots of roasted malt, still there was a bitter off setting point that balanced this beer nicely.
Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Rome. Pours dark unclear amber with a small creamy lasting head. Nose is fruit, yeast and chewy caramel. Chewy malty flavor. Medium bodied. Smooth. .

Draught at Football Pub. 
Clear dark amber - white head. 
Caramel. Fruity. Light soapy. Roasted notes. Light hoppy.

750 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6.2%. Unfiltered and unpasteurised. Recommended serving temperature 8-10 degrees C. Deep golden to amber colour, moderate white head. Moderate aroma of "dusty" hops. Fizzy mouthfeel. The flavour is fairly dry, with just a hint of caramel, and noticeable German hops (Magnum and Hersbrücker) in the finish.

75 cl bottle courtesy of Marco at Birroteca Tana di Luppolo - grazie, signore!  Dark amber color, off white head, good lacing.  Aroma of caramel and black pepper.  Taste is very malty, hints of pepper and light spice.  Light body.  Nice example of the style.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Mouth feel is OK but thats about it. There is some malt, some bitterness but thats almost metallic. Also more alcoholic than expected from this ABV. More like an European Strong Lager than a Bock.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2010. Pours a hazy copper color with a medium size white head. lasted quite long. Aroma is malty, bit sweet. flavor is complex, roasted malt, nutty. hint of alcohol in the somewhat bitter finish. Full bodied, I would have guessed this one to have around 8% alcohol if I hadn´t seen the label. Very nice bock indeed.

Keg (Fa?, Rome)
Deep cloudy orange, small head. Vague beer aroma - sweet malts. Pleasant carbonation, and with icy spicy retronasals. Simple grainy malty body. Crisp hops, and pleasant, slightly sweet overall. Passable bock, low sugars for the style perhaps, but its not thin.

Bottled 750ml -Batch No 372. Hazy orange/pale amber coloured, medium sized off-white head that went away slowly, honeyish hoppy nose. Sweet malty, fruity and caramellish taste with notes of hops and honey. Touch of alcohol in the finish. Surprisingly nice Italian Bock.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome. Amber/brown hazy and medium head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Soft palate, quite refreshing, sweet malt and light caramel, light bitter taste, more dry and hoppy at the end, and low carbonation.

olfatto  profumo di malto e luppolo non molto intenso
  gusto  perde molto dal naso sentori di malto e poco corpo

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2009 ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Che Siete Venuti a Fà) Hazy amber with a large, firm and lacy head. Aroma of berries and grainy-caramely malt. Caramely-malty, grainy flavor with berries and slight acidity. Medium body, soft carbonation. A well-made, balanced bock.

This was a gift from Emanuel at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, April, 2009. It is a solid beer, if a strange interpretation of a bock. Dark brown color, opaque, not like any bock I have had before.  Light in the flavor and aroma, but there is some sugar, earth.  For a bock, it is quite dry, with a flavor of dry hops and lightly bitter grain.

Draft at SD.  Pours  an ugly murky grainy orange sludge with a thin white lacing.  Spicy floral and musky.  Caramel, apple and earth.  Slightly lush with some earthy notes.  Pear and bubblegum to finish.  Decent brew.

Tap at Spuyten.  Pours a nasty crazy yeasty, muddy, orangey brown- looks like the bottom dregs after a primary fermentation- with a small lasting fizzy white head.  Aroma is earthy, spicy, nutty, light fruits- green raisin, light apple, toasty malts, and a moderate sweetness.  Flavor is malty with a slight fruitiness upfront, with more herbs, light grass and a dry spritzy sea salt and hay like character, but as it warms it turns more fruity almost tropical-like- even some juicy fruit- gum hints.  Finishes fizzy airy and dry.
Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. September 08. Pours hazy orange with frothy white head. Very malty with notes of caramel and fruit. Smooth bitter finish. This is a well balanced bock.
Ottima birra la Bibock del Birrificio Italiano, lho bevuta a tavola allIsola della Birra accompagnata con un piatto di tagliatelle ai funghi molto buone. I Funghi dei Nibelunghi.
Bottle at Beer tasting i organised at work ...copper , sweet malty lager nose ... light sweetness ... little fruityness... lager malts ...
Bottle, 6.2%. Weak farty aroma. Hazy orange colour. The flavour is quite malty with some fruit and berry notes. Raspberry and strawberry finish.

75 cL bottle. Pours cloudy to hazy orange with a creamy off-white head. Mild spiced hoppy aroma. Smooth caramel malty and mixed with a nice bitterness. Smooth hoppy and mild flavour with a medium dry yet also mild creamy/mellow yeasty touch into the finish.

Bottle. High white creamy lasting head. Hazy amber body. Weak malty aroma with fruity notes. Mild barley malt flavor with notes of pepper and relatively dry hops leaving a good deal of bitterness in the long aftertaste. Low carbonation.

My Bottom Line:
This Heller Bock sports well-developed sweet cereals that lead to an intelligent grassy hop grip in a wealthy, approachable vehicle.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A thick head of foam covers the cloudy amber-tinged blond.
-This had a bigger body than I expected. I find it a tad too malty to be überdrinkable and perhaps not complex enough to be a sipper.
-A light alcohol presence surprises.
-An undefined fruitiness follows the mildly honeyed, direct cereal sweetness.

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome.

is there anythingyou can’t do augistino? This is a winner a copper blood orange that looks like glass. Lowish gas saturation and a rye caraway nose thats a bit rough. Malt body and a rip of bitter at the back.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2008 Cask at  Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome, Italy. Hazy red colour, wuth a nice creamy head. Aroma is malty, fruity, flowery,and a alcy nose in the end. Flavor has a lots of malts,caramel and alcy mouth feeling. Werry nice malty long finish. This is  a great Bock beer. Thanks to the owner (Manuele) of this fantastic pub: Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome, Italy.

Bottle 100 cl. [Courtesy of Hildigöltur, thanks buddy] Large bubbly and creamy off-white head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Cloudy amber color. Aroma of bread, dusty grain, toasted malt, hint of alcohol. Over the palate came mild fruit, toffee, and hint of floral. Pretty hoppy for a Heller Bock. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and mild dry texture. Moderated sweet and bitter in a great symphony. Bread like and hoppy lingering finish. Excellent and properly one of the best Heller Bock so far even it might not be true to the Heller Bock Style.

Draught, Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome, Italy.  Light bronze color with full head.  Caramel, light, toast-like malt in the nose, a bit light.  Flavor is unique, with toasted, caramel-like malts, a luscious honey character and hints of dark fruit.  Nice sweetness, overall character and a fairly long finish.  Again, impressive brewery.

Deep, cloudy orange amber with a small head. Sweet, somewhat sickly aroma. Flavour was very dry, lightly toasted yeasty malt, dry hops. Enjoyable beer but it just doesnt resemble a Bock at all in my opinion.

From bottle, at Mulligans, Milan. 
Clear amber colour with medium-sized head. Grassy maltiness here, with pretty much fruitiness involved. Very tasty beer with lots of fruits. Low bitterness as it should be, and a late, dry grassiness sets in. Not all malty, since the fruits dominate.

Draught @ Brewery tap, Birrificio Italiano, Lurago Marinone (CO), Italy. Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (081107)
Bottle. Clear orange colour with a medium off white mostly lasting head. Rich malty aroma and taste with a weak hoppy finish.

Bottle @ Italian tasting @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours a great clear red-oranges with a medium dense creamy off white head. Okay lacing. Aroma is sweet malty, wet corn, light rye bread and chocolate. Full and very creamy mouthfeel. Sweet flavour, with an initial metallic off flavour. Lots of bready rye, light vinious warmth and a slight chocolate in the aftertaste. A touch of flowery hops hit me in the aftertaste. A good bock, but thats not really my style...

Medium offwhite head with coarse froth on top. Hazy light amber body. Strong earthy herbal licorice aroma, kind of unbalanced. Dry fruity hoppy taste with herbal malty notes. Dry herbal medicinal aftertaste with papery malty notes. Nice, but unbalanced. (0.75l bottle at Mulligans, Milan.)

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Comments: Draught at the brewpub. Complex, very fruity and malty, toasty example. Exceptional palate, crisp and growing on you. I cant believe how well balanced and fresh this is. World-class bock and second best beer Ive tasted in Italy.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2009  bel colore ambrato carico schiuma ben stabile profumi maltati ed erbacei del luppolo piacevole in bocca corpo medio 
retrogusto non lungo scaldandosi esconi sentori fruttati esotici frutto della passione

Nice orange colour, with a good head. A bit hazy. A powerful nose of malt, ripe fruit and hints of spices, pepper perhaps. Very lasting flavor, developing from malt sweetness in a bitter ending, tipycal of the beers brewed at Lurago. Warming and well carbonated, full bodied. Balanced.
Good malt and hop taste, a bit fruity. Full body, caramel, warmy, some butter taste. Persistent foam, one of the best!

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2009 750 ml bottle. A hazy medium amber beer with a large, almost creamy and lacing white head. Fantastic fresh aroma, moderately malty and hoppy with note sof caramel, grass, herbs, some fruits. The flavour is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, lively carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness. A fruitier and more bitter than usual bock, one of the best in this style and in Italy.

Bottle at 20 Settembre, Parma. Deep, cloudy orange amber with a small head. Sweet, somewhat sickly aroma, some fruit and more than a hint of wet cardboard. Fruity, artificially sweet, with a harsh metallic bitterness. Cardboard. From a one litre bottle, served by the glass at this Parma bar- the opened bottle maybe to be blamed for the off-flavours. Anyway, too sweet for my liking.
Draft at 20 settembre, Parma. Round, aromatic, malty sweet but with a bitter twist in the finish. Almost there.
Wow, this is good.  A true bock beer in the german tradition with full taste and a crisp palate.  The only thing lacking with this beer is the slight reliance on sweetness, I thought.

Aroma floreale di luppolo abbastanza intenso, con note di agrumi e lievito, e con una punta, appena percettibile di caramello. Al palato prevalgono lamaro e lacidulo che genera astringenza, sono presenti anche note dolci. Leggermente troppo acquosa.

Bottle shared with Harry, Blankboy and company, thanks R!!  Dark hazy orange/brown, small tan head.  Fruity dark malt aroma.  Nice balanced ESB type taste, leaning more n the malt side than the hop.  Creamy body.  Another nice one to drink, but probably not a Bock.

Bottle (1000ml).  Shared with blankboy, tupalev, Dave B, and R++ - courtesty of R.  Poured cloudy copper with a solid lasting beige head.  Aroma of apricot, light roast malt and perfumy hops.  Flavour was very dry, lightly toasted yeasty malt, dry hops and a nice kick of tart fruit - very balanced on the palate, soft mouthfeel, well put together.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, tupalev, R. & more -- courtesy of R. Pours a hazy sparkling amber-orange with a large creamy off-white head -- looks great! Aroma is not very Bock-like , its yeasty and grainy with some hops and significant fruit -- still quite pleasant though. Flavour is nice and malty with some grain and fruit -- almost like a Vienna Lager. This is a very enjoyable beer it just doesnt resemble a Bock at all in my opinion.

Barrel Draught at the GBBF, Kensington Olympia 02/08/2001
Amber coloured and strong in alcohol. Fruity apricot aroma and flavour. Pleasant finish.

simply best beer.
unique taste, never tired to drink.
I usually drink it two times a week...

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2005 Like all Birrificios beers but Cassissona, it is better to drink it on tap, preferably at the brewpub. Bottles have sort shelf life. Amber-orange colour with a creamy head.  Aroma is fruitier than you expect in a lager, but its dried fruit and connects more to the malts than to esters. Nice sweet maltiness in the mouth, again dried fruit and apricot. Balanced by a good hoppiness and a bitter finish. Probably my favourite italian draft beer.
Amber coloured. This is a very soft and fruity bock. There are apricot notes in the aroma and in the flavour.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2006 Pours hazy copper golden with a small off-white head. Sweet and rather candied malt aroma with toffee, spices and a vague tone of alcohol. Sweet cramelly and fruity flavor again with that candied note. Very drinkable and pretty tasty and definately one of the better I have had from Italy. Thanks a lot Alex for brining me this gift from the brewer!!
An orange beer with no head. The aroma is sour, malt, and hops. The flavor is sweet malt, caramel, and somewhat flat.

On tap, at Artebirra 2003, Italian Craft Beer festival in Milan. Dark golden-orange colour, light haziness, creamy head. Very fruity aroma ("yellow" fruits: peach, apricot), light caramel, toffee, weak citrussy. Taste is fruity again, clean bitterdry finish. I want to re-rate it soon, at the Birrificio brewpub!

After GBBF in the White Horse, bottle - thanks Lorenzo. Sweet, perfumy nose; lovely gold color; low dissapating head. Warm full round malt body that is unfortunately a little buttery to my palate. A little nutty in the middle of the profile, also oranges. Not very bitter. Smooth, sophisticated bock.
Thank to Lorenzo Dabove for sharing this bottle. Strong buttery aroma and flavor. Caramel and hops. Just a hint of sourness. Lychee fruit. This is not a standard bock beer by any means.
Thanks Lorenzo Dabove: Apricot caramel, parfume like but slightly. Orange flat appearance. Slightly apricot bitter taste, nice medium finish.

Amber colour, clean appereance, huge rocky head. The aroma is malty, with some hazelnut traces. Malty sweetness in the flavour (traces of caramel, peach and toffee), balanced by a nice bitter hoppy finish. Very nice!

Colour is foxy-orange, very little head, cream-white.
Nose: DIACETYL!! D*MN!
Taste is diacetyl again, but thank God, less. Hoppy flavour, resembling English hops - some English bitters have some levels of diacetyl too, indeed. Mouthfeel is also a little oily. Good body. There is no escaping the diacetyl flavour, not in the aftertaste neither, even not with all the hops here.
What can I say? If I get hold of another bottle, I'll try again. When will they learn the merits of lagering and warm/cold storing?
A redish-amber coloured beer.  This is fairly malty with Belgian brown ale like sourness.  This even has a touch of the geuze about it.  The finish is long and fruity.  A good Italian beer.

Frothy belgian blonde style beer appearance with a sightly citric aroma.  The flavour  is like that of a belgian beer sour, but with a malt and lightly hopped finish.  A very drinkable beer with alot about it.

Bottle conditioned (big 1 litre swing top). Deep amber colour, very good rocky head with lots of lace and good condition. Sulphur aromas dominated, malt in the mouth beneath a sulphur note with a faint tartness and a dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2008 Draught at the brewpub2007-12-29, 9-5-9-5-18=46Beautiful color, red - amber, hazy, with a thick and generous creamy head. Nice aroma, of malt and some hop; perfumy; some alcohol too. Good mouthfeel, solid; sweet malt stickyness; it has a very good mix of malt, caramel, hop, with a touch of vanilla, honey and wood, dynamic; getting warmer, a powerful malt releases all its flavor, smashing the tastebuds. High bitterness level. It seems to be more powerful than the 6.2% would suggest; overall its softer, more round and more malty than a classic Bock; take your time to warm this incredible brew (at least 30 minutes), and you will be rewarded with a world class beer. Good body, smooth, lightly sweet, malty, then more equilibrated; candy sugar, light caramel; final more hoppy and dry. Nice palate, hoppy and aromatic.
Amber coloured. Very fruity and delightfully complex. Big nice late bitterness. Overall very enjoyable and balanced.
